intro: Hieracium macrostolonum subsp. wulkense, commonly known as the Wülkense hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a creeping stoloniferous growth habit, allowing it to spread vegetatively. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive lobed or toothed margin.
